title: evmtool: non-parseable output

labels.name: P5
labels.description: Very Low (ex: JSON-RPC json object response not ignoring null keys, typo on a CLI description)

labels.name: TeamChupa
labels.description: GH issues worked on by Chupacabara Team

body:
This commit changed the way that native precompiles are handled. https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/commit/ec4db5b7a767ce1a24475ef84afdbd0ee3c29dce
This has an effect on the evmtool, which now logs a lot of info logs which are not parseable.
Would be great to disable the output for the evmtool.

```

```

Thanks for the heads up @MariusVanDerWijden! We'll get this sorted.
To clarify, you can't fuzz besu's precompiles right now because of these?
I managed to get the fuzzer running with a commit previous to the on linked in the issue

This could also be quieted with a user provided log4j2 config. Also, installing the missing native library would work too.

Can you provide the command line being used? With that we can illustrate how this could be quieted with log4j config files and options.
Not currently seeing this.  If it manifests again please re-open along with os/cpu/etc and command line.
